perturbation.original_text: Accounting statements and, if applicable, royalty payments for products sold will be rendered by each party quarterly within sixty (60) days after the expiration of each calendar quarter.
perturbation.changed_text: Accounting statements and, if applicable, royalty payments for products sold will be rendered by each party quarterly within ninety (90) days after the expiration of each calendar quarter.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by extending the deadline for rendering accounting statements and royalty payments from 60 days to 90 days, creating uncertainty regarding which deadline should be enforced.

perturbation.original_text: Either party, at its sole expense, upon at least thirty (30) days written notice (and not more than once in respect of any accounting period) will have the right to inspect the other party's books regarding the obligations hereunder for a period of two (2) years from the date on which any statement is rendered.
perturbation.changed_text: Either party, at its sole expense, upon at least fifteen (15) days written notice (and not more than twice in respect of any accounting period) will have the right to inspect the other party's books regarding the obligations hereunder for a period of one (1) year from the date on which any statement is rendered.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by changing the notice period for inspecting books from 30 days to 15 days, limits to twice per accounting period from once and shortening the inspection window from 2 years to 1 year, creating uncertainty regarding which terms apply.

perturbation.original_text: Thereafter, it will be deemed to have consented to any such statements or accountings which will then be considered an account stated as between the parties, not subject to any objection for any reason whatsoever. Provided the objecting party has made timely written objection, as aforesaid, such party may file an action regarding same within two (2) years and six (6) months after the applicable statement is rendered, after which time any such action will be deemed barred.
perturbation.changed_text: Thereafter, it will be deemed to have consented to any such statements or accountings which will then be considered an account stated as between the parties, not subject to any objection for any reason whatsoever. Provided the objecting party has made timely written objection, as aforesaid, such party may file an action regarding same within one (1) year after the applicable statement is rendered, after which time any such action will be deemed barred.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by shortening the timeframe to file an action after an objection, it goes from two years and six months to one year. This conflict creates uncertainty regarding the deadline for filing an action.
